dmca.title: Unauthorized image use & hotlinking of images.
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: Michael Brown [mailto:michaelsimages@sc.rr.com] 
Sent: Saturday, January 28, 2006 2:35 PM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: Unauthorized image use & hotlinking of images.

This information provided is about the unauthorized use/downloading of
images within this particular site, and the hotlinking of images.

The site is:  http://www.stumbleupon.com/

This site almost encourages it members in the illegal downloading of images
and the hotlinking of images throughout its site.
I have found a number of my images, "all of which have been copyrighted"
within the United States, the US Copyright Offices, and found on this site.
Numerous times I have contacted the site owners about this matter with no
response, other than the removal of the images in question.
Still, after removal, more images will show up on this site that do not
belong.
Other photographers that I do business with also have their images  within
this site, many of which are being hotlinked.  All photographers have been
notified!

Throughout this site, there are litterally hundreds if not thousands of
these images, virtually none which are owned by the members who posted them.

For myself, just one of the images I have found is this one which was put on
this site today, January 28 - 2006.
http://leelee129.stumbleupon.com/
The image is from the "Macro Art In Nature" site, with a notification that
it is copyrighted on the site and that "any" usage is prohibited.
Again, others have been removed but they still continue to be downloaded.

Another well respected photographer who is known worldwide, inserted this
little notification in place of the image that was being hotlinked to.
http://raytracer.stumbleupon.com/tag/photography/

It is our hopes that this can be resolved "quickly".
The owners of this site should let their members know about copyright
infringment and the illegal downloading/hotlinking of images, but has
nothing within their site about it.

If not resolved in a reasonable amount of time, we will collectively persue
this with our copyright attorney that we do business with on a regular
basis.

All information has been recorded, screenshots, page information, etc. from
this site for our records.


Would appreciate your response to this matter so I may let the other
individuals know where we stand.


Thank you for your help,
Michael Brown
South Carolina
